edit_course module

class edit_course.EditCourseForm(students: dict[str, Student], instructors: dict[str, Instructor], courses: dict[str, Course], callback, action_handler: ActionHandler, course_id: str, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Toplevel

A Tkinter-based form for editing course details.

This class creates a window with form fields for editing course information, including the course name, assigned instructor, and enrolled students.

Parameters:

  • students (dict[str, Student]) – A dictionary of student objects keyed by student ID.

  • instructors (dict[str, Instructor]) – A dictionary of instructor objects keyed by instructor ID.

  • courses (dict[str, Course]) – A dictionary of course objects keyed by course ID.

  • callback (callable) – A function to be called after successful form submission.

  • action_handler (ActionHandler) – An instance of ActionHandler for performing actions.

  • course_id (str) – The ID of the course to be edited.

add_action() → Course | None[source]

Updates the course’s record with new details.

This method validates the input fields, updates the course’s information, and updates the students and instructors they are registered or assigned to.

Returns:

The updated Course object if successful, or None if validation fails.

Return type:

Optional[Course]

delete_action()[source]

Deletes the Course from the system.

This method removes the course’s record from the system, updates the students and instructors that they were registered or assigned to, and deletes their entry from the action handler.

Returns:

None

validate_fields()[source]

Validates the input fields of the form.

Ensures that the course name, and instructor ID are filled out correctly.

Returns:

An empty string if all fields are valid, or an error message string detailing the issues.

Return type:

str
